capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a well-documented fact. I mean, it's not exactly surprising given his background and the fact that he was a double agent working for the Order of the Phoenix while pretending to be a Death Eater. He played a crucial role in the fight against Voldemort, and his loyalty to the greater good ultimately prevailed despite his complicated past.

Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a bit complicated, to be honest. I mean, he was a double agent working for the Order of the Phoenix while pretending to be a loyal Death Eater. It's hard to say whether his true loyalties were with the Dark Lord or with the greater good. But one thing's for sure, he played a crucial role in helping Harry and Dumbledore during their time at Hogwarts.

Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a bit complicated, to be honest. I mean, he was the Potions master for many years and seemed to have a certain... respect for the school, but at the same time, his behavior towards students was often quite intimidating and unfair. He had a very dark past, you know, and that's something that still affects him even after all these years. I think it's safe to say that he's not exactly the most popular person among the Hogwarts staff, but despite all that, he did play an important role in the school's history.
